data.title: Make Captures Upgradeable
data.body:
Part 2 of #12604.

~~For test case i made D2K Engineer require Outpost to be able to capture.~~

Looks like the version i have was before #12862 merged, i think i applied it on my installment correctly (and it runs fine so it should be) but please be sure this doesn't revert anything from there.

data.title: Refresh new/updated maps in lobby #3483
data.body: Added 'Refresh' button to lobby map browser to refresh new/updated maps.

data.title: Arrows showing where beacons has been placed
data.body:
So you can see where beacons are placed if you have only started, out of power, low tech level, no radar etc. Just like in GTA, but maybe they sholud be at the screen edge.
![index](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/24170686/f0802ad2-0e81-11e7-9b80-917f47f5b373.jpg)

Also see #10390

data.title: Add tooltips to production statistics #12820
data.body:
Tooltip with list of currently produced buildings and units.

![obrazok](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16348750/24166583/04481ce0-0e74-11e7-8b34-828fde80224d.png)

data.title: Map.ActorsInWorld appears to include Player in its Actor[] return array
data.body:
Map.ActorsInWorld appears to include at least one Player entity, which can lead to unexpected behaviour when attempting to perform certain functions on this array.

-------------------------------------

**To reproduce:**
Run this Lua function in a map with a "Germany" player

```
function DeleteBaseNodeActors () -- any name will do
  Trigger.AfterDelay(0, function()
    Utils.Do(Map.ActorsInWorld, function(a) 
      if a.IsDead then return end
      if a.Owner.Name == "Germany" then 
        if a.HasProperty("Destroy") then 
          a.Stop()
          a.Kill() 
        end
      end
    end)
  end)
end
```

This will return an error:
... ---> Eluant.LuaException: [string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: Actor 'player' does not define a property 'Kill'

-------------------------------------

Using 

`Map.ActorsInBox(Map.TopLeft, Map.BottomRight, function(a) return true end)`

in place of

`Map.ActorsInWorld`

resolves this issue.

-------------------------------------
The problem can be made more serious by using a.Destroy() instead of a.Kill(). Attempting to call a Player (any player) value after using Destroy() on a Player results in a crash:

`Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at OpenRA.Mods.Cnc.Effects.GpsDot.OpenRA.Effects.IEffectAboveShroud.RenderAboveShroud(WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.<Draw>m__9(IEffectAboveShroud e)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.<SelectManyIterator>d__16`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.<ConcatIterator>d__58`1.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.<ConcatIterator>d__58`1.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.Draw()
   at OpenRA.Game.RenderTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)`

data.title: Added tooltip to Lobby Map title #12930 #12595
data.body: Added tooltip to Map title

data.title: Unsupported OpenGL version on Intel Atom N450 (GMA3150)
data.body:
Hi! I'm trying to run OpenRA on my ASUS EeePC 1005PE netbook equipped with an Intel Atom N450 processor (integrated Intel GMA3150 graphics processor) and 2GB or RAM. OpenRA fails to run claiming that OpenGL 1.4.0 is not supported. What is the minimum OpenGL version is required to run the game? Thanks!

Here is the graphics.log file.

Unsupported OpenGL version: 1.4.0 - Build 8.14.10.2230

OpenGL Information:
Vendor: Intel
Renderer: Intel Pineview Platform
GL Version: 1.4.0 - Build 8.14.10.2230
Shader Version: 
Available extensions:
GL_EXT_blend_minmax GL_EXT_blend_subtract GL_EXT_blend_color GL_EXT_abgr GL_EXT_texture3D GL_EXT_clip_volume_hint GL_EXT_compiled_vertex_array GL_EXT_cull_vertex GL_SGIS_texture_edge_clamp GL_SGIS_generate_mipmap GL_EXT_draw_range_elements GL_SGIS_texture_lod GL_EXT_rescale_normal GL_EXT_packed_pixels GL_EXT_separate_specular_color GL_ARB_multitexture GL_EXT_texture_env_combine GL_EXT_bgra GL_EXT_blend_func_separate GL_EXT_secondary_color GL_EXT_fog_coord GL_EXT_texture_env_add GL_ARB_texture_cube_map GL_ARB_transpose_matrix GL_ARB_texture_env_add GL_IBM_texture_mirrored_repeat GL_EXT_multi_draw_arrays GL_NV_blend_square GL_ARB_texture_compression GL_3DFX_texture_compression_FXT1 GL_EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic GL_ARB_texture_border_clamp GL_ARB_point_parameters GL_ARB_texture_env_combine GL_ARB_texture_env_dot3 GL_ARB_texture_env_crossbar GL_EXT_texture_compression_s3tc GL_ARB_shadow GL_ARB_window_pos GL_EXT_shadow_funcs GL_EXT_stencil_wrap GL_ARB_vertex_program GL_ARB_fragment_program GL_EXT_stencil_two_side GL_ARB_vertex_buffer_object GL_EXT_texture_lod_bias GL_NV_texgen_reflection GL_ARB_depth_texture GL_WIN_swap_hint 
System.InvalidProgramException: OpenGL Version Error: See graphics.log for details.
   at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.OpenGL.Initialize()
   at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice..ctor(Size windowSize, WindowMode windowMode)
   at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.DefaultPlatform.CreateGraphics(Size size, WindowMode windowMode)
   at OpenRA.Renderer..ctor(IPlatform platform, GraphicSettings graphicSettings)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
Unsupported OpenGL version: 1.4.0 - Build 8.14.10.2230

data.title: Fatal error after a random amount of time
data.body:
Hi,

My game crashes after a random amount of time. A window pops up with the following message:
"The NVIDIA OpenGL driver detected a problem with the display
driver and is unable to continue. The application must close.

Error code: 3
Would you like to visit http://www.nvidia.com/page/support.html for
help?"

I have another error window which reads:
"OpenRA has encountered a fatal error and must close.
Refer to the crash logs and FAQ for more information."

All logs are empty but the "debug" and "perf", which read as follows:
(there is no Exception.log)
Debug.log:
local.mix: failed to resolve filenames for 48 unknown hashes
Found 36 domains for movement class 699 on map Desert Shellmap.
Found 3 domains for movement class 4096 on map Desert Shellmap.
Found 3 domains for movement class 4097 on map Desert Shellmap.
--Tick: 1 (net)
--Tick: 2 (local)
--Tick: 3 (local)
--Tick: 4 (net)
--Tick: 5 (local)
--Tick: 6 (local)
--Tick: 7 (net)

data.title: Host can change Team and Spawn of any player. #12936
data.body: Host can change Team and Spawn of any player to make it simpler and quicker to setup new game.

data.title: Tile errors on the map Minor Pressure
data.body:
This map was introduced into the official RA map pool by #12767 but has some bad tiles.

Bad tile locations:
44,102
60,95
58,94
65,29
32,30
37,32
31,31
96,58
95,93

Link to revision:
http://resource.openra.net/maps/20048/

data.title: Refactor SupplyTruck/AcceptsSupplies to *Cash traits
data.body:
~It's only used by our RA mod and no more likely to be used by any 3rd-party mod than any other RA-specific logic (less likely, in my opinion), so I think it can be moved to Mods.Cnc.~

Renamed to more generic `DeliversCash`/`AcceptsDeliveredCash` and added Type/Stance tags instead.

data.title: Add RevealOnDeath trait
data.body:
...and use it in D2k to reveal las actor position for 4 seconds.

Note: `RevealOnFire` still needs to stay on sandworm, because swallowing doesn't trigger regular death.

Closes #7916.

data.title: Tile errors on the map Vihaan Lunta
data.body:
This map was introduced into the official RA map pool by #12767 but has a few bad tiles.

Bad tile locations:
49,60
51,62
51,67
45,59
39,68
106,83 (non-issue; under shroud)
70,0 (non-issue; under shroud)
44,106 (non-issue; under shroud)
56,98 (ore on cliff)
50,69(misplaced piece of ore)

*This map also contains out of bounds ore under the shroud for most of the exterior patches.  (I left this unchanged.)
Link to revision:
http://resource.openra.net/maps/20046/

data.title: [RA] [Map pool] Fix tile errors on various maps.
data.body:
**Update**: Includes tile fixes to official maps:

- Minor Pressure #13001

- Vihaan Lunta #12998

- Ensio Kaivo #12994

data.title: Remove IDisable - part 2

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: This PR converts render traits from having a `PauseOnLowPower` property and support powers to being [pausable-]conditional (a subclass of `PasuableConditional`) and converts AffectedByPowerOutage to granting a condition. This continues #12955. Fixes #12797.

data.title: Prevent Harvester from getting deadlocked
data.body:
- Related to issue #12817. It occurs very frequently when AI builds many harvesters. After this fix, I never saw AI harvester getting stuck. I only verified it with AIs so I'm not sure if this fixes issues with ally harvesters. (but probably will)
- Also, harvesters can get stuck when trying to harvest a tib/ore patch underneath a friendly unit. Especially true when AI has a rally point set on ore. Harvester will not mine until the unit is removed for its use as attacking force. I don't think Notifying blocker is a good solution as they might be standing there to protect the harvesters. In this fix, harvesters take such cells as un-harvestable cell.

- This is the behavior of RA1 and CNC1 harvesters. I can make units stand on tib patch so that the tib patch underneath will start growing and eventually spread to adjacent cells., effectively making the units my own blossom tree :)

data.title: Tile errors on the map Ensio Kaivo
data.body:
This map was introduced into the official RA map pool by #12767 but it has a number of bad tiles.

Bad tile locations:
12,102
59,106
108-111,91
94,75
106,59
108,55
103,29
94,19
11,62
22,25
10,0(non-issue; under shroud)
0,16(non-issue; under shroud)

I've fixed all the tile errors except the one at 22,25 as it is quite minor and requires an altered design to fix.

Link to revision:
http://resource.openra.net/maps/20035/

data.title: Fix TS observer flag alignment

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
Fixes #8788.

![flag1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2857877/24076798/57b96aa0-0c3a-11e7-9e50-8f19524148a9.png)

data.title: Overhaul launch-game.sh
data.body:
Another step towards being able to remove the mod launcher:

- Adds mod chooser popup if zenity available
- Adds at least OSX and hopefully general POSIX support
- Improved text-mode output when zenity not available.

I have used http://www.shellcheck.net/ to check for portability and confirmed that this works as expected under linux (with gnome 3) and macOS.

data.title: Heli goes to pad if SD is occupied
data.body:
If there is a queue on the SD the heli goes to the pad instead.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GM2uXP3SVEo

data.title: Per mod settings #8276
data.body:
Added support for per mod settings in settings._mod_.yaml file. Currently supported options:

Player - Name, Color, LastServer (MP Direct IP Address:port)
Faction, Team (1 Faction for both Skirmish and Multiplayer)
Hotkeys
Server - all options from settings.yaml (MP Create Game name, port, map,...)

data.title: Add a note about EnemyWatcher being required for On(Player)Discovered
data.body: If you don't know about this requirement you're left behind with no clue why the trigger doesn't fire.

data.title: Investigate renaming OpenRA.Game to OpenRA.Engine
data.body:
It would be more correct and less misleading, especially on Windows with its separate launcher exe(s).

Related to #12554 and #12966.

data.title: Add "Fast" game speed to all mods
data.body:
Sitting smack in the middle between "Normal" and "Faster", except for order delay (which is same as Faster to avoid rejected/dropped orders).

Closes #12509.

data.title: Expand the documentation of Reinforce(WithTransport)
data.body:
It wasn't quite clear before that `ReinforceWithTransport` returns an array looking like
`{ transport, { actorA, actorB, ... } }`.

data.title: When i download game files i get Error : Invalid Archive
data.body: When i download game files i get Error : Invalid Archive so whats the problem guys? i`m getting this for like 1 year whenever i come back to game...

data.title: TS - Add Tech Levels
data.body:
Fixes #5416.

Currently it is like that:

Low: Power, Barracks, Ref, Silo, WFac, Radar, Wall, Gate, Vulcan, Laser Tower, Rifleman, Grenadier, Rocket Soldier, Medic, Engineer, Harvester, Wolverine, Buggy, Cycle.

On Low, Radar is available but only provides Radar. It doesn't enable any unit.

Medium: Adv. Power, Power Turbine, Tech Center, Repair Pad, Helipad, SAM, Jumpjet, Cyborg, APCs, Tick Tank, Titan, Sensor Array, MCV, MRV, Harpy, Carryall, Orca Fighter.

On Medium, Tech Center  is available but only provides prerequisites for MCV, nothing else.

NoSW: Temple of Nod, Stealth Generator, RPG Cannon, Obelisk, Mutant Hijacker, Cyborg Commando, Ghost Stalker, Mammoth Mk.II, Distruptor, MLRS, Artillery, Stealth Tank, Banshee, Orca Bomber.

Full Tech: Upgrade Center, Tiberium Waste Facility, EMP Cannon, Plugs, Missile Silo, Weed Eater.

data.title: Riflemen are unable to harm veteran heavy armor
data.body:
Here you can see the riflemen and the light tank shoot itself without taking damage but the flame tower can still damage it.

Also the physics of how the light tank can shoot itself is a mystery to me. 

https://youtu.be/LvbI7BsszAM

data.title: Real tough guy difficulty doesn't fit the UI #12844
data.body: Difficulty dropdown in Missions browser is now wider so also 'Real tough guy' difficulty (used in 2 missions) is not truncated.

data.title: Fix GrantConditionOnPrerequisite not refreshing when the actor's owner changes
data.body: Also moved `GrantConditionOnPrerequisite` into the `Conditions` folder, as the other `GrantConditionOn*` traits are in there as well.
